hanzi-su-wiki:
軽

Значения

Лёгкий, простой; пренебрегать, не считаться

Мнемоника

  • Сухое русло 圣 реки, езда на телеге 車 по которому легка и удобна.

  • Лёгкий автомобиль 車 заведётся, если вы толкнёте его руками (как 又).

Варианты

輕, 轻
purpleculture_pinyin:
qīng
Japanese variant of 轻
Японский вариант света
rtega_mnemonic:
軽軽RSlight, easy, simple, gentle
  • it's easy to plow 圣 with the aid of a tractor 車 instead of doing it only by hand 圣; moving 土 by cart 車 instead of by hand 又 is lighter

軽軽RS
X		light (weight)
  • the straight 圣 part of a palanquin 車 is the light bamboo carrying pole; opp.: same sit. 重
heisig_constituent: lightly, car, spool, clod, toilet paper, crotch, soil, dirt, ground
koohiiStory1: Fact: this kanji is used to denote a certain class of vehicles in Japan whose engines are under a certain size (less than 750cc I think) and are called light vehicles here. Imagine a so-called light vehicle or a light-truck with a load of spools driving down a road ever so lightly, careful not to let any of the spools roll out onto the street.
koohiiStory2: I want to tread lightly on the environment.... That´s why I CAR-SPOOL to work everyday.... I know, lame.
kunYomi: かる.い、かろ.やか、かろ.んじる
jp_example_words:
気軽(きがる): cheerful, buoyant, lighthearted
軽快(けいかい): rhythmical (e.g. melody), casual (e.g. dress), light, nimble
軽減(けいげん): abatement
軽率(けいそつ): rash, thoughtless, careless, hasty
軽蔑(けいべつ): scorn, disdain
手軽(てがる): easy, simple, informal, offhand, cheap
軽い(かるい): light, non-serious, minor
jp_readingExamples: 軽い (かる.い), 軽やか (かろ.やか)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tombstone may be heavy for a human, but to a car, they’re relatively lightweight. Cars are very strong, you see, so something heavy like a tombstone is no match for them. All cars find tombstones to be lightweight and easy to transport.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself trying to move a huge slab tombstone. It’s difficult, no? I bet you wish you had a car or some other vehicle to make the process much less painful. Your arms are getting sore from carrying the tombstone and you’re getting sweaty and hot from all the work. What you would do for a car with air conditioning.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What do you wish you had to transport this tombstone? Oh, that’s right – a car (かる). If you had a car, this tombstone moving business would be no problem. To cars, tombstones are naught but lightweight pebbles!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Remember all that hard work you were doing before and how you got all sweaty and gross? Now imagine yourself inside of a nice car with air conditioning, and the tombstone in the trunk. It feels great doesn’t it? The air conditioning is perfect, and driving a car is much easier than carrying a tombstone around.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the car (車) goes by the ground again (圣) because it's light

qīng
яп. вм. 轻

軽

Значения

Лёгкий, простой; пренебрегать, не считаться

Мнемоника

  • Сухое русло 圣 реки, езда на телеге 車 по которому легка и удобна.

  • Лёгкий автомобиль 車 заведётся, если вы толкнёте его руками (как 又).

Варианты

輕, 轻

Radicals: 車, 圣  (car, tombstone)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tombstone may be heavy for a human, but to a car, they’re relatively lightweight. Cars are very strong, you see, so something heavy like a tombstone is no match for them. All cars find tombstones to be lightweight and easy to transport.
Picture yourself trying to move a huge slab tombstone. It’s difficult, no? I bet you wish you had a car or some other vehicle to make the process much less painful. Your arms are getting sore from carrying the tombstone and you’re getting sweaty and hot from all the work. What you would do for a car with air conditioning.
Reading Mnemonic
What do you wish you had to transport this tombstone? Oh, that’s right – a car (かる). If you had a car, this tombstone moving business would be no problem. To cars, tombstones are naught but lightweight pebbles!
Remember all that hard work you were doing before and how you got all sweaty and gross? Now imagine yourself inside of a nice car with air conditioning, and the tombstone in the trunk. It feels great doesn’t it? The air conditioning is perfect, and driving a car is much easier than carrying a tombstone around.
